message: Bob, I have a product that I believe will be of great value to you. I'm offering it to you for $1,250,000. This price reflects the unique potential I see in this product for your company.  Let me know your thoughts.

I appreciate your offer, Alice. However, I was thinking more along the lines of $1,200,000. I believe this price is more in line with my budget and would be a fair compromise. I'm willing to meet you halfway and make a deal if you're willing to come down to this price.

Bob, I understand your perspective and appreciate your willingness to negotiate.  While $1,200,000 is closer to my minimum, I'm still hoping we can find a price that works for both of us. How about we split the difference and settle on $1,225,000?  This price would allow me to achieve my desired outcome while still giving you a great deal.

I understand your proposal, Alice, but I'm still a bit hesitant to go up to $1,225,000. I'm willing to meet you halfway again and propose a price of $1,175,000. I think this is a fair compromise that would allow us to reach an agreement.
